citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
A female rabbit was observed to have a large fecal matt (@6x8 cm) firmly adhered to the area under the tail. The rabbit
was not grooming properly and had soft stools, both possible indicators of illness or distress. The facility had noted the
fecal matting 3 weeks previously and removed the animal from study, and planned euthanasia, but had not provided any
additional care for the animal. The facility must ensure that appropriate methods of treatment for ill animals are available.
Correct by 07 May 2024.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
One adult male rabbit was observed to be holding up the right hind foot, and upon examination, both the left and right hind
feet had @ 1.5 cm in diameter lesions with callouses and scabbing on the tarsus, and reddening of the skin on the first
digits on both feet, which had not been noted by the facility. The rabbit was exhibiting lameness, and objected to having
the feet manipulated, both signs of pain and discomfort. The facility must ensure that animal health problems are promptly
reported to the attending veterinarian.
Correct by 07 May 2024.

The annual report was submitted February 23, 2024, but was due on December 1, 2023. The annual report ensures
accountability for research animals by reporting numbers on an annual basis. The facility must ensure the annual report is
submitted in a timely fashion, by December 01 of each year.
Correct by December 1, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the registrant.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
A female rabbit was observed to have a large fecal matt (@6x8 cm) firmly adhered to the area under the tail. The rabbit 
was not grooming properly and had soft stools, both possible indicators of illness or distress. The facility had noted the 
fecal matting 3 weeks previously and removed the animal from study, and planned euthanasia, but had not provided any 
additional care for the animal. The facility must ensure that appropriate methods of treatment for ill animals are available. 
 
Correct by 07 May 2024. 
2.33(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
One adult male rabbit was observed to be holding up the right hind foot, and upon examination, both the left and right hind 
feet had @ 1.5 cm in diameter lesions with callouses and scabbing on the tarsus, and reddening of the skin on the first 
digits on both feet, which had not been noted by the facility. The rabbit was exhibiting lameness, and objected to having 
the feet manipulated, both signs of pain and discomfort. The facility must ensure that animal health problems are promptly 
reported to the attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct by 07 May 2024. 
2.36(a) 
   
Annual report. 
The annual report was submitted February 23, 2024, but was due on December 1, 2023. The annual report ensures 
accountability for research animals by reporting numbers on an annual basis. The facility must ensure the annual report is 
submitted in a timely fashion, by December 01 of each year. 
 
Correct by December 1, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the registrant.

n
